Token.Abstract: Like \c NSNull, this class provides a singleton object that can be used to represent a \c NULL or \c nil value. Unlike \c NSNull, this object behaves more similarly to a \c nil object, responding to messages with "zero" values. This eliminates the need for \c NSNull class or equality checks with collections that need to contain null values.
Returns the singleton \c EXTNil instance. This naming matches that of \c NSNull -- \c nil as a method name is unusable because it is a language keyword.
